column11: Description
Kamigotchi kurrency
Sacred paper which can be sacrificed for VIP status.
Redeemable for one Kami. You should take this to the vending machine…
Allows you to reroll a Kami once. You should take this to the vending machine…
Your ticket to great fortunes. In yellow.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In orange.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In pink.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In red.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In blue.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In green.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In white.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In grey.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In purple.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In lime green.

column3: Kamigotchi World Passport (1-bit Red and White)
column11: Your ticket to great fortunes. In 1-bit red.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In 1-bit pink.
Your ticket to great fortunes. In 1-bit green.

column3: Kamigotchi World Passport (1-bit Black and White)
column11: Your ticket to great fortunes. In 1-bit black.

Kamigotchi World’s premium game currency.

You want this. You want this so bad.
Wood in its unprocessed form. Grows on trees.
It’s just a stone. Can be used to get Stone.
Can be reprocessed into valuable raw Microplastics.

It’s a pine cone. 

Slightly sacred.
A small chunk of scrap metal. Maybe useful if processed.
A somehow-unbroken jar of clear glass.
A crystal of pure red amber, formed deep in the forest.
You can’t tell whether it’s a very dark purple or actually black. A rare flower.
A reflection of fallen Narcissus… Has its own uses and applications.
A herb with many applications. Not often found here….
A mushroom that bruises and bleeds like flesh. Some believe that they feed on decaying spirits.
A dry and bitter berry coated with chalky white fungus. The berry itself is inedible; useless except as a medium for a unique wild yeast.
An ancient coin. Despite a worn and dull finish, it still glitters in the light. Valuable to certain individuals.
Long-stemmed mushrooms dried in a small bundle. Although this mushroom has no known medicinal, culinary, or recreational use, it may be a functional building material.
These verdigris-coated pipes jut from the cave walls with no connection to any apparent plumbing system. Their presence defies conventional explanation.
Even something as small and disposable as a cigarette can be tied to a memory and be given a spiritual essence. You can break this down into Microplastics.
The woman on the face of this coin has long pointed ears like a caracal. The language inscribed is incomprehensible. Unless you find a collector, this coin is only valuable as scrap.
Petrified bone in the form of a large stony chunk. If this fragment came from the skeleton of an animal, it must have been the size of a whale.
A small reusable cup crafted from stone. Useful for drinking potions or other beverages.
Fine translucent powder. A promising new substance in hexerei.
Some people think this is very good for you.
Fine powder made from crushing a red amber crystal. Can be used to sand and polish metals.
Useful alkaloids in a sticky black goo. One of the most ancient ingredients.
Poisonous to living things, but useful when making medicines and potions.
Makes a cooling and relaxing tea. Also used in various magical applications.
A dark, reddish powder that resembles dried blood, or maybe just coffee. Edible, but can also be used as an ink or dye.
A chalky fungus scraped from a rare berry. Can ferment certain materials to produce a rejuvenating beverage.
Holy Dust diluted into a quantity of water. Forms a thin syrup that can be measured out for crafting.
A sweet, spicy syrup made from the natural resin found in the trees of Kamigotchi World. Useful for a number of recipes.
Like crude oil with the texture of clay. It seems to absorb the light around it. Could be an ingredient in powerful magic.
A heavy block of unpolished and imperfect stone. Symbolic of unrefined potential. Masters can craft this into something useful.
Laminated timber made from thin strips of material that have been pressed and glued together. It can be cut into useful planks after a large mass has been shaped and dried.
A rough ingot of greenish metal. Soft enough to shape with force and heat and strong enough to hold an edge. Only .888 percent pure, so be careful when you work.
One of the six essences. A coil of roaring blue flame.
One of the six essences. A skyfish in a perfumed cloud.
One of the six essences. A weeping orb of sludge.
One of the six essences. A stone flower bud.
One of the six essences. A hole in space with grasping tentacles.
One of the six essences. A leafless tree with a reflective surface.
The combined six essences. A ball of pure sensation.

Capable of raising a Kamigotchi from the dead. 

These ribbons are greatly prized….

The card depicts the figure of an ancient god silhouetted by a wreath of energy that obscures the details of his face and attire. Melkarth grants a blessing of rebirth to fallen warriors. Activating this Spell Card will revive a Kamigotchi that has been incapacitated.
An artifact that carries the magic of resurrection. Scholars say it resembles a sheaf of reeds, or a spine, or a tree. Use this on a liquidated Kami to bring it back from death.
This sacred dust can be used to rename Kamigotchi… At the proper place.
Feed this to a Kamigotchi to give them a little bit of experience.
Provides a decent amount of XP when fed to a Kami.
This gives a lot of XP when fed to a Kamigotchi.
This is far larger than any XP Candy you’ve seen before. Gives a huge amount of XP when fed to a Kamigotchi.
The card depicts a pale sprout emerging from rich, black soil. Activating this Spell Card on a Kamigotchi will restore 20 HP and grant 100 XP.
The card depicts a teardrop-shaped flowerbud growing out of light brown soil. Activating this Spell Card on a Kamigotchi will restore 50 HP and grant 200 XP.
The card depicts a flower heartily blooming in pale and sandy earth. Activating this Spell Card on a Kamigotchi will restore 100 HP and grant 1000 XP.
The card depicts a massive flower spreading across the frame. A baby sleeps in the center. Activating this Spell Card on a Kamigotchi will restore 100 HP and grant 5000 XP.
It pulses with warmth. Give this to your Kami to grant it a large amount of XP.
It feels slightly warm in your hand. Give this to your Kami to grant it a moderate amount of XP.
The crystal beats like a real heart. It radiates with heat enough to warm your surroundings. Give this to your kami to grant it a very large amount of XP.
A rare gem with an incandescent color. Some say the stone has a wild spirit and will leap out of your pack if unattended.
A rare gem with a tranquil color. Some say that if you drop it into water, it won’t disturb the surface. This jewel boosts a kami’s Fertility, enhancing its type advantages when harvesting.

The Wonder Egg was filled with soot and ash, but also a large blue pearl. Give this pearl to your Kami to grant it a temporary +1 to Harmony and Violence. If your Kami is liquidated, the pearl breaks and the power is lost.
This egg seems fresh, and refuses to spoil even out of the shell. Still, it reeks of sulfur. Your Kami can eat this to restore HP.
The most basic form of food available in this world - restores 25 Health to a Kamigotchi.
These burgers, still in their original wrapping, are occasionally found in the scrapyard. Apparently Kamigotchi love them.
These fruit candies contain a huge amount of energy. Restores 50 Health to a Kamigotchi.
Heavy duty rations by a Kami’s standards.. Restores 100 Health to a Kamigotchi.

The card depicts a mortally wounded man lying in a field of flowers. Some flowers take root on his body and knit the wounds closed while others bloom from the spilled blood. Activating this Spell Card on a Kamigotchi will restore 100 Health.
Sticky sap with a flavor like spiced honey. An energizing snack by itself, but also useful in a number of recipes.
A sweet confection that appears on mushrooms and bones. Close inspection reveals this candy is actually the honeydew of a scale insect.
Sweet golden apples on a dry silver branch. Said to be a divine gift, they are extremely rare. They’re more often found in places without trees.
A deep blue flower with a shape reminiscent of the blue butterflies common across the Kamigotchi World. It has a crisp, sweet, and refreshing flavor.
Give to a Kami to increase their XP by 1000.
Give to a Kami to increase their XP by 15000.
Give to a Kami to reset their skill points.
Give to a Kami to decrease loss of health during the next Harvest by 25%.
Give to a Kami to increase the MUSU gained from the next Harvest by 25%.
A letter written by a Kami with sincere remorse for its actions. Lowers Recoil when liquidating other Kami.
This shiny purple rock attracts grains of $MUSU. It dramatically increases the proportion of $MUSU a kami retains when it’s liquidated.
Magical bells that gradually increase Harvest Intensity over the next long-term harvest. Your Kami will ring this chime until it breaks.
A lightly fermented beverage that grants a burst of spiritual energy. Dramatically reduces Cooldown Shift for a kami’s next action.
Most Kamigotchi find this bitter potion unpleasant, but some thrive on it. Expands a Kami’s Attack Threshold Shift by a small percentage.
A deep-green potion with a grainy texture and dense mouthfeel. Fortified with rare red amber and the essences of old memories.
A magical talisman that burns easily. Using this on a Kami intensifies their overall sensitivity to Types, buffing their advantages on liquidations but nerfing their advantages on defense.
A matte-black paste in a plastic jar. A secret incense recipe created by Mina that allows individuals without bodies to smoke tobacco.
Liquor distilled from a mash made from mushrooms and black poppy. An underworld favorite.
Legendary medicine believed to be the stuff of rumors. A piece of flesh has been preserved inside using ancient techniques. Give this to a Kami to grant them a temporary bonus to maximum Health.
This glue even sticks to intangible things. Can be used to add additional Cooldown to an enemy Kami and temporarily lock it down to a Node.
Dangerous to both living and nonliving beings. When used on Kamigotchi, it causes them to lose HP at a faster rate while Harvesting.
Highly corrosive. Can be used to clear barriers of plant or fungal matter. It can also be used on a Kamigotchi to lower its defenses. The Blight is particularly dangerous to Normal-type Kami.
Also called a Defixio or Katadesmos. This ancient tablet is inscribed with a curse of weakness. Although it was meant for a long-dead human, Kami can use it on their own kind.
The lowest tier of giftbox. You can get XP candies, cheeseburgers, and even a few rare item drops from this!
A gold-trimmed and colorfully painted treasure chest. The gift inside must be particularly valuable.
A cracked egg held together by blood-red wax. The contents are a surprise.
Open this magical booster pack to receive a Spell Card. You might find something super rare!
A sacred box containing exactly one Mochi.
Restorative ice-cream. Food for you, personally. Restores a little bit of your stamina.
A slightly larger and higher-quality ice-cream. What is this made of? Restores a medium amount of stamina.
A huge, lavishly decorated ice-cream. It doesn’t seem to be melting at all… Restores a lot of stamina.

The card depicts a flooding river beneath the night sky. The magical waters grant a bounty of stamina, and the reeds grow nearly as tall as the pyramids. Activating this Spell Card on an Operator will restore 80 Stamina.
This rare crystal formation is soft to the touch, sweet, and edible. You can consume it to restore a large amount of Stamina.
Can be used to break down ingredients.
Can be used to make Potions at a riverside.
For driving screws. May be of practical use….
A golden disk. It resembles the tympan of an astrolabe, but the engraving doesn’t look right.
A durable part of some kind of high-tech machinery. It has wear and corrosion like it’s been exposed to the elements for thousands of years.
A golden disk inlaid with other metals. It resembles an overhead map of a temple complex. Seems to depict roads, pyramids, and other structures.
Capable of divining some things beyond the perception of mortals.
This device dates to thousands of years old and is constructed in Egyptian style. It can be used to generate electrical power. The process through which this occurs is unknown.
“Kamigotchi World Maps.” A data chip found in the Lost Skeleton’s laptop. It looks damaged, but it might still be readable.
A data chip found in the Techno Temple. Looks to be in good working condition.
Although this lens has a slight crack, it can still be used to focus and magnify light. Scans indicate this item to be hundreds of thousands of years old.
Looks like a small wired relay box on the surface. A tiny humanoid imp lives under the faceplate and manually operates the contacts. This item can be used in crafting certain complex devices.
